channel.title: blog on STEEVdotnet
channel.description: Recent content in blog on STEEVdotnet

item.title: Lenovo Yoga C630 Progress - 2021 Edition
item.description: So the 5.14 kernel is out, There are still 9(?) patches that are external to the kernel for C630 support, 3 related to the battery that need to be reworked, 5 related to the panel/bridge/backlight controls, and one to enable the IPA driver (LTE modem) in the dts file. There are a few minor issues still, audio occasionally requires a few (up to 3) reboots, but it works, if you have the alsa-ucm-conf package installed from the linaro repository.

item.title: Lenovo Yoga C630 Progress
item.description: DO NOT WIPE THE WINDOWS PARTITION UNTIL YOU’VE PULLED THE FIRMWARE FROM IT. Progress so far with the Lenovo Yoga C630 Thanks to Bamse we now have both USB-C ports working on the c630. His branch is https://github.com/andersson/kernel/commits/wip/c630-5.7 What I’ve done so far to get it working: This version of steps is what I use, you will likely want to skip Linus' tree, and just use bamse as the base, unless you want to deal with merge conflicts.

item.title: First Blog Post
item.description: Welp, let’s try this again. See if hosting a blog via github and letting me push automatically updating the blog is better than having to login to a website and randomly enter text and shit.
